Methods in org.gridgain.grid.cache.datastructures that throw GridRuntimeException

          Adds specified item to the queue without blocking.

          Bulk operation for adding more than one item to queue at once without blocking.

          Removes all of the elements from this queue.
 void GridCacheQueue.clear(int batchSize)
          Removes all of the elements from this queue.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.contains(Object item)
          Returns true if this queue contains the specified element.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.containsAll(Collection<?> items)
          Returns true if this queue contains all of the elements in the specified collection.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.isEmpty()
          Returns true if this queue contains no elements.
 Iterator<T> GridCacheQueue.iterator()
          Returns an iterator over the elements in this queue.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.remove(Object item)
          Removes a single instance of the specified element from this queue, if it is present.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.removeAll(Collection<?> items)
          Bulk operation that removes all of this queue's elements that are also contained in the specified collection.
 boolean GridCacheQueue.retainAll(Collection<?> items)
          Retains only the elements in this queue that are contained in the specified collection.
 int GridCacheQueue.size()
          Returns the number of elements in this queue.
 Object[] GridCacheQueue.toArray()
          Returns an array containing all of the elements in this queue.
<T> T[]
GridCacheQueue.toArray(T[] a)
          Returns an array containing all of the elements in this queue; the runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array.
